title: China to send top Minister to SL amid trade roiled by Trump’s tariffs
byline: In the wake of Sri Lanka trying hard to mitigate the impact from the chaotic announcement of reciprocal tarrifs announced by U.S. President Donald Trump, Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao is expected to visit Sri Lanka in June in a bid to foster trade links, an informed source said.

title: Over 600 tonnes of garbage in Kandy
byline: Devotees who visited Kandy during the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic have haphazardly disposed more than 600 tonnes of garbage into the environment by 12.00 noon yesterday.

title: Appointments for CT, MRI scans at National Hospital cancelled
byline: The Picture Archiving and Communication System (PAC System) at the National Hospital has been out of service for the past two weeks leading to the suspension of appointment scheduling for CT and MRI scans, sources said.

title: Devotees’ unclaimed luggage to be handed over in Kandy
byline: The Civil Security Department is set to launch a programme to hand over uncollected luggage left behind by devotees who attended the exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic at the Dalada Maligawa in Kandy, the Central Province Chief Secretary’s Office said.

title: Ranil arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe appeared before the Bribery Commission and is testifying at the moment, his office confirmed.

title: SL must chart its own path in tourism: SLTDA chief
byline: Sri Lanka must forge its own path in global tourism rather than attempting to compete with high-volume travel destinations such as Thailand and Malaysia,

title: Illicit cigarette market surges nearly 20% to 1.16 bn sticks in 2024
byline: Illicit cigarettes continued to erode the tobacco monopoly of Ceylon Tobacco Company PLC, with a significant 19.6 percent Year-on-Year (YoY) growth and soaring to 1.16 billion sticks in 2024.

title: Nine people killed after car plows into crowd at Vancouver Filipino festival
byline: A driver plowed a car into a crowd at a street festival celebrating Filipino heritage in Vancouver on Saturday night, killing at least nine people and injuring others.

title: Suspect detained over seizure of heroin and ’Ice’ worth Rs. 8 million
byline: A 27-year-old resident of Kadawatha was ordered to be detained for a period of seven days under Section 82(3) of the Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs Ordinance following his arrest with a large stock of narcotics.

title: Over 200 polls-related complaints within 24 hours
byline: A total of 203 fresh complaints related to the upcoming Local Government elections have been reported, marking the highest number of complaints reported within a 24-hour period since March 20.

title: Thailand decides not to return Muthu Raja to Sri Lanka
byline: The Thai government has announced that the elephant named Muthu Raja, which was taken to Thailand while under the care of the National Zoo, Dehiwala will not be returned to Sri Lanka.

title: Cardinals set to pick conclave date to elect new pope
byline: Red-hatted cardinals were expected to pick a date Monday for the conclave to elect a new leader of the world’s 1.4 billion Catholics, following the death of Pope Francis.

title: CA dismisses Prasanna Ranawera’s writ petition
byline: The Court of Appeal today dismissed the writ application filed by former Minister Prasanna Ranaweera, who sought an order to prevent his arrest in connection with the alleged illegal sale of government land in Kelaniya.

title: British national smuggling Rs. 63 Mn worth gold nabbed by Customs at BIA
byline: A UK national trying to smuggle in over two kilos of gold jewelry worth around Rs.63 million from Dubai was apprehended by the Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport.

title: North Korea confirms troop deployment to Russia, hails ’heroes’
byline: North Korea confirmed for the first time on Monday that it had sent troops to fight for Russia in the war in Ukraine under orders from leader Kim Jong Un and that it had helped regain control of Russian territory occupied by Ukraine.

title: Withdrawing PC funds from bank is not a crime: RW
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe who made a three-hour statement to the Bribery Commission today, said that withdrawing funds of the Uva Provincial Council from the bank and spending it on recurrent or capital expenditure is not a crime.

title: Importers deny drop in vehicle sales, 75% of imports already sold
byline: While rejecting media reports claiming there is a decrease in sales of imported vehicles, the Vehicle Importers’ Association of Sri Lanka (VIASL) said today that since the resumption of vehicle imports, nearly 75 percent of imported vehicles have already been sold.

title: Kandy city free of health hazards: KMC
byline: The Kandy Municipal Health Department said that the Kandy city is not facing any threat of diseases or health hazards in the aftermath of the large crowds that gathered to pay homage to the Sacred Tooth Relic.

title: CBK complains to EC on misuse of her name in election campaign
byline: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga has written to the National Election Commission over the unauthorised use of her name and photographs in election propaganda by the ‘People’s Alliance’ party.

title: Australia’s ruling party to hike student visa fees again in pre-election pledge
byline: Australia’s ruling Labor Party said on Monday it would raise visa fees for international students to A$2,000 ($1,279) if reelected, the latest measure aimed at the lucrative education sector that has been a major source of immigration.

title: China: A more trustworthy partner
byline: According to the World Bank’s latest report, Sri Lanka’s economic growth rate is expected to reach 3.5% this year, consistent with the October forecast, but challenges from high US tariffs and high poverty rates cannot be ignored.
